ğŸ¿â„ï¸ Come with me for a thrilling snow hike in les 7 laux ski station, where we will have a two schuss adventure! We will park at Prapoutel and start with an easy trail that will soon become a steep climb up to the top of the ski station. There, we will hope for a clear sky and a stunning view, unless the clouds crash our party. ğŸŒ¥ï¸ We will probably have our lunch break on the windy and cold summit, and then turn into ice cubes. ğŸ¥¶ After that, we will start our loop down. Donâ€™t forget your sledge or thick plastic bag to slide down the station and reach back the car. ğŸ›· You can also leave a second pair of dry shoes in the trunk of the cars. ğŸ‘Ÿ

ğŸ”ï¸ Join me for a hike to Pic Saint-Michel, a beautiful peak near Grenoble. We will start from the ski station and hike along the mountain ridge. On the way, we will see the â€œTrou Saint-Michelâ€, a deep hole that some of us might want to explore. We will also visit the â€œVertige des Cimesâ€, a metal grid platform that gives a thrilling view of the valley below (not recommended for those who are afraid of heights). At the top of Pic Saint-Michel, we will enjoy the panorama if the sky is clear. Then we will slide down to the ski station. ğŸ›·
Donâ€™t forget to wear warm hiking shoes and why not put plastic bags inside to keep your feet dry. It will be cold! â„ï¸

How about a snowy walk in Chamrousse? ğŸ”ï¸ You'll need hiking shoes with good crampons or you'll end up with wet and frozen feet ğŸ˜±. And you might slide without them â›¸ï¸. Hiking poles are also a good idea to avoid slipping on the snow â„ï¸. It will feel like -10Â°C ğŸ§Š on top, with lots of clouds â˜ï¸ and maybe some snowflakes ğŸŒ¨. Don't forget to bring a thick plastic bag ğŸ› to slide down the slopes ğŸ›·. We probably won't need snowshoes as there is not much snow ğŸ¥¾. Weâ€™ll meet at the Echirolles tramway station Denis Papin and walk on a flat path to leave the city behind. It will be a nice warm-up for us ğŸ˜Š. Then weâ€™ll follow a trail and enter the forest ğŸŒ². Weâ€™ll go up and reach the town of Jarrie. There weâ€™ll see the castle â€œChÃ¢teau de bon reposâ€ ğŸ°. We can take a break there and have our lunch ğŸ½ï¸.

After that, weâ€™ll continue our hike and climb a little more. Weâ€™ll try to find some chestnuts ğŸŒ° along the way. I hope there are some left, and that they are not too small or eaten by worms ğŸ˜¬. Weâ€™ll enjoy a "beautiful" view over Champ-sur-Drac ğŸŒ„.

node.title: ğŸŸ¢ ğŸ¥¾ Easy Hike - Fort Saint-Eynard (2023) ğŸŸ¢ ğŸ¥¾
node.description:
ğŸ’¡ Read the full page by clicking on "Read more"/"Lire la suite"...ğŸ’œ
Joining the event = Accepting the rules (See rule section below)

=== Summary ==

An nice easy hike enjoy the weekend and get some mild fitness.

Rain Date: Sat./Sam. 28th Oct

The next in a series of "Easy Hikes Around Town Without Cars" GAC Events that I will be hosting this summer/autumn (Trains, Trams, Bus, Telepherique only!)

ğŸš‹ Starting from bus stop outside of Grenoble National Art Museum
ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Note that the "fort" may be closed to public, so we will hike 'around' it.

There is a beautiful place from which to enjoy the Sunset.

== ğŸ—¨ï¸ EN/FR ğŸ—¨ï¸ ==
ğŸ¦…/ğŸ“ : We speak English/French in all our events. Don't be worry if your English/French is not that good. Nos Ã©vÃ¨nements sont en Anglais et FranÃ§ais. Ne soyez pas inquiets si votre niveau d'anglais n'est pas "suffisant".

== ğŸ¥¾ Hike "Fort Saint-Eynard" ğŸ¥¾ ==

Topo & GPX track: https://www.alltrails.com/explore/map/tue-05-jan-2021-22-32-690f44c (Recycled from January 2021)
Distance: \~5.5km (round trip)
Time: 3h of hike
Elevation Change D+: 550m

=== Detailed Plan / Schedule ===

NOTE: (Schedule Plan under final tuning)

* X: Meet and board [10:45] TAG Bus 62 at stop Notre-Dame - MusÃ©e (Just in front at street)
* X: Arrive Col de Vence\*\* Bus Stop and Commence Hike
* X: Arrive at Top/Fort - Begin Group Picnic / Visit Museum / Shops
* X: Begin return hike to Col de Vance Stop
* X (+/-): Catch TAG Bus 62 back to Grenoble MusÃ©e
* X: Arrive back in Grenoble (in front of National Museum)

Busses back to Grenoble on Jour Ferre/Sunday depart Col de Vence towards Grenoble at: 15:29 && 16:59 so we must arrive in time for 15:29 otherwise it is a 6km hike back to Grenoble or wait 1.5hrs

https://www.tag.fr/ftp/fiche_horaires/fiche_horaires_2014/HORAIRES_62.pdf

Rally Point (bus stop) on Google Maps: https://goo.gl/maps/xZiF8srLmTxCgRwi6

== â” What do you need to Bring â” ==

* Decent Hiking shoes ğŸ¥¾ (or any 'non flat/slippery' shoes)
* Clothes for hiking between 10degC and 24degC
* Water ğŸ§ƒ (1-2L) + Some snacks ğŸ« / Tea/Coffee in Thermos
* Sun Hat / Chapeau + ğŸŒ Creme Solaire (Sunscreen Lotion)/ ğŸ˜ Sun glasses (lunettes de Solaire)
* Bug Spray / Gloves / Any other safety gear you need (your **EpiPen** for example)
* ğŸ˜ Your smile / ğŸ˜Š Happiness
* Money/Argent for TAG Tram (OURA Card)

***

== ğŸ’¡ Rules of The Day ğŸ’¡ ==

* ğŸš¶â€â™€ï¸ğŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸ The GAC group is about hiking ğŸ¥¾ , fitness, nature, active lifestyle --- and sure, also socializing and making friends and language/cultural exchange. **BUT NOT about flirting or speed dating!** We want everyone to feel comfortable during our events. â›”
* ğŸ˜ Hiking is about enjoying and respecting mother nature!
* Don't throw/dump any garbage ğŸš® in nature, not even fruit pelt: ğŸŒ(2 years for decomposition), ğŸŠ (6 months); egg shell ğŸ¥š (3 years)
* Don't be (too) late ğŸ˜‡ We have a large 30 minute queue window. If you arrive after we depart, call my mobile and we'll find a way for you to connect with us down the road.
* If you finally can't join us, please unsubscribe from the event or at least write a message here to announce your cancellation. ğŸ’œ That way, we won't wait for you ğŸ’œ
* ğŸ’Ÿ You are responsible of your own health and security
* If you have any medical conditions that we should be aware of in an emergency, please feel free to contact me privately!
* ğŸ˜· COVID-19 rules at the moment: [https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19](https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19)

If you have any questions, please ask! Feel free to send me a Private Message or on WhatsApp (+1-412-378-3823)

Car share is 12â‚¬ per person. We will be 5 by cars with tents, etc. You will probably have some stuffs on your knees, our cars are not that big.

== ğŸ¥¾â›ºğŸ”´ Hike : daily hikes & night camp "Le Plateau de Bure" ğŸ“¡ğŸ“¡ğŸ“¡ğŸ‘½ ==

* âš« Not for noobs/beginners

=== Day 1 ===
Weâ€™ll start with a 2-hour car ride ğŸš— to La Cluse. Our first hike begins with light bags ğŸ’, carrying only picnic ğŸ¥ª and water ğŸ’§. Weâ€™ll traverse through forest ğŸŒ³ and grasslands ğŸŒ¿, reaching the mineral-rich landscape of â€œCol de Plate Contierâ€ ğŸª¨. Our goal is the peak of â€œTÃªte de Garnesierâ€ â›°ï¸. After our descent, weâ€™ll drive for \~30m to our night camp ğŸ•ï¸ and set up our tents by throwing them from the car trunk (head lamps on).

After a pleasant breakfast, weâ€™ll pack up our tents and prepare our light bags ğŸ’. Our first task is to climb to the highest point of our hike, Pic de Bure at 2709m â›°ï¸. Once weâ€™ve taken in the view, weâ€™ll continue our hike on the â€œPlateau de Bureâ€, walking alongside the large satellite antennas of the observatory ğŸ“¡. Who knows, maybe some of us will hear an alien ğŸ‘½? From there, weâ€™ll complete our loop hike all the way down to the cars ğŸš—. Finally, weâ€™ll embark on our 2-hour car ride back to Grenoble.
